creator: martin@algesten.com
text:
I have my own jsp tag extension class extending 
javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TagSupport, and that works fine. 

However if I change the class after deploying it, to extend 
javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.BodyTagSupport and then updating the jar in the 
webapps/myapp/WEB-INF/lib directory, the server gets confused. 

It keeps complaining that my class can't return EVAL_BODY from doStartTag() 
since I don't implement BodyTag (even though I clearly do). 

The solution is to delete the appropriate files in the work/ directory.

Won't be addressed for Tomcat 3.2.2, but will be evaluated for a later release.

Also note that some times the timestamps on files that get installed into a 
running server can cause some problems.  If the timestamp on the 
generated .class file is later than the *new* JSP file then Jasper won't re-
translate the JSP file and you might end up with a mismatch between the classes 
used to compile the JSP page and the classes that currently exist in the JAR 
file.  This may or may not be the problem, but is something to keep in mind.
